properties.publicTransport: Buses will run frequently between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Buses will be in high demand so allow extra travel time. Avoid the largest crowds by visiting on a weekday instead. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sculpture by the Sea exhibition returns to the Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk for 18 days from Friday 17 October to Monday 3 November.

With around 450,000 people expected to visit throughout the exhibition, significant delays are expected on roads approaching Bondi and Tamarama beaches including Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. 

Changed traffic conditions and parking restrictions will be in place.

Motorists should avoid driving through the area where possible or expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time, particularly on weekends.

Road closures and changed traffic conditions:

  • Local roads in Bondi, Bronte and Tamarama will be closed at various times during the event including sections of Notts Ave, Fletcher St, Marks Ln, Kenneth St, Bayview St, Wolaroi Cr, Ashley St, Turner St, Cross St, Birrell St, Darling St, Silva St, Illawong Ave, Carlisle St, Rowland Ave and Wilga St. Access for residents will be maintained.
  • One-way traffic conditions will be in place on roads around the coastal walk between 7.30am Friday 17 October and 6.30am Tuesday 4 November. Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic controllers and exercise caution.

Special event clearways: Strict parking restrictions will be in effect each weekend of the event on Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 October, Saturday 25 and Sunday 26 October and Saturday 1 and Sunday 2 November at the following times and locations:

  • 7am to 2pm: Bondi Rd between Old South Head and opposite Sandridge St at Bondi Beach (northern side)
  • 12pm midday to 7pm: Bondi Rd between Sandridge St at Bondi Beach and Oxford St at Bondi Junction (southern side)
  • 8am to 4pm: Campbell Pde between Queen Elizabeth Drive and Beach Rd at Bondi Beach (Eastern side)

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures 

Vehicle access for local residents will be maintained for the duration of the road closures. Traffic controllers will be on site to permit access to properties. 

  • 7:30am - 6:30pm Daily (Fri 17 Oct - Mon 3 Nov): Notts Ave, Rowland Ave, Silva St, Wilga St. 
  • 7:30am - 6:30pm Weekends Only (18-19 Oct, 25-26 Oct, 1-2 Nov): Wolaroi Cres 
  • 7:30am Fri 17 Oct - 6:30pm Mon 3 Nov: Carlisle St, Fletcher St, Kenneth St, Marks Ln (one-way southbound traffic only) 
  • 10am Fri 17 Oct - 6:30pm Mon 3 Nov: Ashley St, Bayview St, Illawong Ave 

One-way traffic changes 

The following roads will become one-way only, for the duration of the event: 

7:30am - 6:30pm Daily (Fri 17 Oct – Mon 3 Nov) 

  • Bayview St closed southbound from Hewlett St to Bronte Marine Dr. Northbound traffic only. 

6:30am Fri 17 Oct - 6:30am Tue 4 Nov 

  • Dellview St closed southbound from Fletcher St to Pacific Ave. Northbound traffic only. 
  • Gaerloch Ave closed eastbound and northbound from Dellview St to Alexander St. Southbound traffic only. 
  • Thompson St closed eastbound from Ashley St to Mirimar Ave. Westbound traffic only.  

10am Fri 17 Oct - 6:30pm Mon 3 Nov 

  • Birrell St closed eastbound from Tamarama St to Cross St. 
  • Cross St closed southbound from Birrell St to Turner St. Northbound traffic only. 
  • Darling St closed eastbound from Alfred St to Ashley St. Westbound traffic only. 
  • Mirimar Ave closed southbound from Thompson St to Hewlett St. Northbound traffic only. 
  • Turner St closed eastbound from Cross St to Ashley St. Westbound traffic only.
arrangementElements.title: Road closures & Changed traffic conditions

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around the course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

From 5am to 4pm the following roads within Callan Park will be closed:

  • Central Ave between Military Dr and North Crescent/Waterfront Dr
  • Military Dr between Wharf Rd and Central Ave 
  • North Crescent from Park Dr 
  • Waterfront Dr between Military Dr and Central Avenue

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and exercise caution.

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around the course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

From 7:30am to 4pm 1 lane eastbound closed on River Rd between Lane Cove Country Club driveway (Stevenson St) and Greenwich Hospital Pedestrian Crossing (St Vincents Rd).

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and exercise caution.

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around the course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

  • From 6am to 5.30pm Durham St between Church St and Heath Ave, and Heath Ave from Durham St will be closed. Managed access will be maintained for local residents.

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and exercise caution.

Special event clearways will be in place at the following locations to facilitate Sydney Trains trackwork replacement bus operations.

  • Chalmers St, western side, between Cleveland St and Devonshire St, and
  • Chalmers St, eastern side, between Cleveland St and Rutland St.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Teddy Swims at Qudos Bank Arena from Tuesday 14 - Thursday 16 October. Show starts each night at 7.50pm and finishes each night around 10.30pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Newcastle Jets at polytec Stadium. Kick-off at 3pm, full-time around 5pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to and from the stadium. Allow extra travel time and use local parking. 

Dane Drive will be closed before the match between the Central Coast Highway and Donnison Street and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

properties.publicTransport: Some buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and clearways will be in place in Mosman to safely facilitate the Freedom of Entry Parade for HMAS Penguin from 10.50am until 1.10pm.

Roads closures

  • From 10.50am until 11.50am: sections of Prince Albert St, Military Rd, Gouldsbury Rd, The Crescent, Myahgah Rd and surrounding local streets
  • Military Rd will be closed between Almora St and Middle Head Rd from 11.20am to 11.45am

Special event clearways will be in effect from 9.30am to 12pm on sections of Prince Albert St, Bradleys Head Rd, Middle Head Rd, Military Rd, Raglan St, Avenue Rd, Belmont Rd, Gouldsbury St and The Crescent.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Route 437, 440 and 445 bus services will be diverting while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Italian Festa held along Norton Street from 10am to 5pm. 

Traffic will be heavy in the area and on approach to Leichhardt, including on Parramatta Rd and City West Link while closures are in place and attendees travel to the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and expect delays.

Changed traffic conditions including road closures and parking restrictions will be in place.

Road closures:

  • From 3am to 9pm Norton St will be closed between Marion St and William St
  • Local roads adjoining Norton St will also be closed including Allen St, Arthur St, Short St and Wetherill St
  • From 6am to 9pm additional local roads will be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect on sections of Norton St and William St from 3am to 9pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.﻿

webLinks.linkText: Crows Nest Fest - Road Closure flyer

properties.publicTransport:
Route buses 115 and 263 will divert around a section of Willoughby Road and use temporary stops from 12:01am to 11pm while roads are closed for the event.

Allow extra time and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Crows Nest Fest from 10am to 5pm on Sunday 19 October.

Changed traffic conditions including road closures and parking restrictions will be in place to safely facilitate the event.

Traffic is expected to be heavy on roads approaching Crows Nest including along the Pacific Hwy and Falcon St throughout the day.

Road closures from 12:01am to 11pm

  • Willoughby Rd between Burlington St and Albany St 
  • Willoughby Rd (one-way) closed from Burlington St to Falcon St 
  • Clarke St between Willoughby Rd and Oxley St 
  • Clarke Ln between Hume St and Oxley St 
  • Burlington St between Willoughby Rd and Willoughby Ln 
  • Holtermann St between Willoughby Rd and Zig Zag Ln 
  • Hume St between Pacific Hwy and Pole Ln 
  • Hume Ln between Clarke Ln and Pole Ln 
  • Zig Zag Ln closed near Burlington St 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic controllers on site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

webLinks.linkText: Granny Smith Festival - Ryde Council website
Granny Smith Festival - Road Closure Map

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 515, 521, 541, 544 and 555 will be diverting and using different stops while roads are closed. Check travel alerts for the latest information and plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Granny Smith Festival, running from 9am until 8:30pm on Saturday

Changed traffic conditions include road closures and temporary no stopping zones will be in effect.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic in the area will be heavier than usual while closures and local traffic detours are in place.

Motorists should also exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Road closures

  • From 5.30pm Fri 17 Oct to 10pm Sat 18 Oct including sections of West Pde, Hillview Rd, Rowe St, Progress Ave, Coolgun Ln and Trelawney St.
  • 5am to 12pm Saturday only, closures will be in place on Lakeside Rd between Wingate Ave and Hillview Rd, and Clive Rd
  • 6am to 7pm Saturday only, closures will be in place on Hillview Ln between Shaftsbury Rd and Lakeside Rd, and Hillview Lane car park
  • 8am to 11.30am Saturday only, closures will be in place on sections of Lakeside Rd, Hillview Rd, Shaftsbury Rd, Rowe St, Glen St and Richards Ave.

Temporary no-stopping zones will be in effect from 3.30pm Friday 17 October on sections of Trelawney St, Hillview Rd and Lakeside Rd, and between 6am and 9am Saturday 18 October on sections of Rutledge St. Check signs carefully. For more information see the event website.

roads.mainStreet: Lakeside Road, Glen Street, Shaftsbury Road and Rowe Street

properties.publicTransport: Race day tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Everest Carnival: Everest Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse on Saturday. First race at 12.30pm, last race at 6.10pm.

With more than 40,000 punters expected, Everest race day ticketholders are urged to catch public transport to avoid traffic delays. 

Heavy traffic is expected on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the event.

The right-turn bay into Randwick Racecourse gate 1 on Alison Road (eastbound) will be closed. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special Event Clearways 

Special event clearways will be in effect at the following times and locations: 

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and the Grand Drive roundabout (western side) 
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and the roundabout at the entry to Randwick Racecourse (both sides) and Bowral Street, between Doncaster Avenue and Building No.16 Bowral Street (southern side)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between Gate Two Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern sides) 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Fridayz Live at ENGIE Stadium. Show starts at 4.30pm and finishes at 11pm

Sydney Olympic Park will be busy with more than 40,000 music fans attending Fridayz Live as well as thousands attending a concert at nearby Qudos Bank Arena.  

  • Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as attendees travel to and from the festival.  
  • Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.
  • Attendees who need to drive should pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close some local roads to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map for more details.

properties.publicTransport:
A free event shuttle will run between Wollongong Station and WIN Entertainment Centre to transport participants and spectators to the event area. It will run via Burelli Street, Corrimal Street, Crown Street and Harbour Street. Event shuttle route map (pdf 77KB)

Some regular bus service diversions and stop closures will be in place, Check signs at impacted bus stops for alternative stop locations. For bus service disruption information, including alternative bus stops for those that are closed, check travel alerts or plan your trip using the Trip Planner.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect around Wollongong to support the 2025 World Triathlon Championship Finals.

Affected Roads: Campbell St, Wilson St, Smith St, Hector St, Georges Pl, Harbour St, Crown St, Burelli St, Marine Dr, Endeavour Dr, Cliff Rd, Bourke St, Corrimal St, Kembla St, George Hanley Dr, Squires Way, Carters Ln, Elliotts Rd and Pioneer Rd. There will also be a number of side streets closed with local access only.

Thursday 16 October: Road closures (5:15am to 7:30pm), Special Event Clearways (1am to 8pm)

Friday 17 October: Road closures (5:15am to 6:30pm), Special Event Clearways (1am to 7pm)

Saturday 18 October: Road closures (5am to 9pm), Special Event Clearways (1am to 8pm)

Sunday 19 October: Road closures (5:30am to 8pm), Special Event Clearways (1am to 8pm)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its location.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers v Melbourne City at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, finish around 6.55pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Parramatta Road, Church Street, Victoria Road, James Ruse Drive and Pennant Hills Road. 

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

properties.publicTransport: Route 900 buses will be diverting while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Parramatta Lanes is taking place in the Parramatta CBD from Wednesday 22 to Saturday 25 October. Being held at over 20+ sites including gardens, rooftop carparks and lanes, the event starts daily at 5pm. The event will finish at 10pm on Wednesday and Thursday, and at 10.30pm on Friday and Saturday.

Road closures will be in place from Monday 20 to Monday 27 October on sections of Macquarie St, Phillip St and George St to safely facilitate the event. Parking restrictions will also be in place on George St, Macquarie St and Phillip St so check signs carefully.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the area and on detour routes as attendees travel to and from the event. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd, and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Triathlon Pink at Sydney Olympic Park is taking place from 6am to 10am on Sunday.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to safely facilitate the event including sections of Edwin Flack Ave, Olympic Blvd, Grand Pde, Dawn Fraser Ave and surrounding local roads between 1am Friday 17 Oct and 12pm Sunday 19 Oct. See the interactive map for closure details.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and within the park. 

If you have to drive, competitors can show their race bib at the Aquatic Centre Service Desk and collect a voucher to receive 4hrs of free parking.

properties.otherAdvice: The Mitchell Hwy (Summer St) will be closed eastbound between Sale St and McNamara Ln. The closure will be a 'rolling closure' managed by NSW Police. Westbound traffic will be largely unaffected, however there will be no access from Summer St into McNamara Ln, Lords Pl, Anson St and Sale St intersections. All intersections will have traffic controllers.

The Cowra Spring Show will commence on the Friday 17 Oct and finish on Saturday 18 Oct. There will be a speed reduction, stop slow control and No parking zones on the Mid Western Highway from Friday 11:00 - 23:00 and Saturday 06:00 - 23:00

Murrumbateman Field Days is expected to attract approx. 20,000 people across the two days of the event.

It is expected that traffic will be heavy along the Barton Highway for the duration of the event.

Event traffic will de detoured via Euroka Ave, Patemans Ln and Murrumbateman Rd with access to car parking via Murrumbateman Rd.
properties.diversions: Northbound motorists heading to the event will be detoured via Euroka Ave, Patemans Ln and Murrumbateman Rd with access to car parking via Murrumbateman Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Bus routes 14, 41, 43 and 48 may experience short delays during the event period.
properties.otherAdvice: The 15km running event will start at Adamstown and follow the Fernleigh Track to Belmont. Traffic control and stop/slow on Park Ave, Dibbs St, Burwood Rd, Cowlishaw St and Kalaroo Rd. Traffic signal changes on Burwood Road to allow safe crossing of runners.

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle bus will operate on Saturday from Morisset Station to Showgrounds 12:30 – 9:30pm.
properties.otherAdvice: The show will be held on Saturday 18 to Sunday 19 October. There will be increased pedestrian activity as event goers make their way to and from the event. Traffic controllers will be on site to direct motorists on Saturday afternoon.
Kidman Way will be closed for the Griffith Multicultural Parade between 10am and 2pm. Detours will be in place.
properties.diversions:
Northbound motorists will be detoured via Kookora Street, Yambil Street, and Jondaryan Avenue.

Southbound motorists will be detoured via Wakaden Street, Kooringal Avenue, Kookora Street and Yambil Street.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFLW: Sydney Swans v Carlton. First bounce at 1.05pm, full time around 3.05pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Henson Park as attendees travel to and from the event. Travel with your group and allow extra travel time on Sydenham Rd, Illawarra Rd, Livingstone Rd and Addison Rd. 

Woodland St and Holmesdale St will be closed from 8.45am until 1.45pm on game day.

Limited parking is available at on Centennial St at Henson Park and on local surrounding streets. Plan to arrive early to secure a parking spot.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrians in the area.
Motorists are advised of speed reductions on the Kings Highway at four crossing points between Old Nelligen Road and Western Distributor Road for the Inward Bound running event.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting from their regular routes while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected at the Lane Cove Rotary Fair on Sunday from 9am to 4pm.

Heavy traffic is expected in the area while roads are closed to safely facilitate the event. Motorists should expect delays and allow extra travel time or avoid the area where possible.

Road closures from 6am to 7pm:

  • Longueville Road between Birdwood Avenue and Central Avenue
  • Burns Bay Road between Tambourine Bay Road and Finlayson Street.
  • Birdwood Avenue/Longueville Road intersection will operate under traffic control with No Right Turn to Longueville Road from Birdwood Avenue.
  • Birdwood Lane (vehicle access for residents permitted when safe to do so)

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and follow directions of traffic controllers.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
David Tao at Qudos Bank Arena on Sunday. Show starts at 7.30pm and finishes around 10.30pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details

arrangementElements.html:

properties.otherAdvice:
The Citrus Sculptures event is on once again, with 80,000 expected to attend.

Banna Avenue will be closed between Crossing Street and Jondaryan Avenue for the Griffith Citrus Sculptures event, including set up and pack down.

Detours will be in place.
properties.diversions:
Light vehicles will be detoured via Yambil St.

Heavy vehicles will be detoured via Bridge St and Crossing St.

On the 12 and 26 Oct between 6am and 2.30pm all vehicles will detoured via Bridge St and Crossing St.

properties.otherAdvice:
Delays are expected on Mid Western Hwy in Cowra as thousands of motorsport fans make their way home from the Repco Bathurst 1000.


From 8am to 2pm Monday 13 October as fans head home from Bathurst, traffic will be heavy on the Mid Western Highway approaching Cowra with reduced speed zones and traffic control in place to manage traffic queues and ensure fans get home as safely as possible.

 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time.

Delays are expected on Mid Western Hwy in Cowra as thousands of motorsport fans make their way home from the Repco Bathurst 1000.


From 8am to 2pm Monday 13 October as fans head home from Bathurst, traffic will be heavy on the Mid Western Highway approaching Cowra with reduced speed zones and traffic control in place to manage traffic queues and ensure fans get home as safely as possible.

 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time.

Delays are expected on Mid Western Hwy in Blayney as thousands of motorsport fans make their way home from the Repco Bathurst 1000.


From 7am to 12pm on Monday 13 October as fans head home from Bathurst, traffic will be heavy on the Mid Western Highway approaching Cowra with reduced speed zones and traffic control in place to manage traffic queues and ensure fans get home as safely as possible.

 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time.

Delays are expected on major roads approaching Bathurst including the M4 Mwy, Great Western Hwy and Bells Line of Rd from Sydney, Mitchell Hwy from Orange, Mid Western Hwy from Cowra and Castlereagh Hwy from Mudgee.

Traffic controllers will be on-site on local roads to manage access to and from the Mount Panorama precinct.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time over the weekend and expect delays on Monday 13 October as fans head home from Bathurst.

_____________________________

VICTORIA PASS - Monday 13 October

Traffic is expected to be heavy along the Great Western Highway from Bathurst towards Sydney, with significant eastbound delays expected at Blackheath in the Blue Mountains. Reduced speed zones will be in place on the Great Western Highway at Mount Victoria, with queuing expected.

In the event of eastbound traffic queues extending from Blackheath to Mount Victoria, traffic management will be in place at the bottom of Victoria Pass on Great Western Highway, Little Hartley. Traffic will be held at this location to avoid breakdowns resulting from queuing on Victoria Pass, and to ensure the safe passage of motorists up the Pass. 

_______________________________

COWRA - Monday 13 October

Reduced speed zones will be in place on the Mid Western Hwy in Cowra with delays and queuing expected

arrangementElements.html: OSOM operators are advised to avoid eastbound travel on the Great Western Highway between Lithgow and Katoomba on Monday 14 October between 9am and 1pm.

properties.publicTransport: L1 light rail services run regularly to stops at Darling Harbour. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
South by Southwest (SXSW) Sydney Festival 2025 from Monday 13 to Sunday 19 October.

Various conference and expo events will be held at venues in Darling Harbour including Tumbalong Park and the ICC Sydney.

Allow extra travel time on roads in the city and Pyrmont around Darling Harbour as traffic may be heavier than usual before and after events, particularly during weekday peak travel times.

Motorists should exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney, Sydney Streets- Potts Point

properties.publicTransport: Route 311 buses will be diverting around the closures and missing some stops. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Darlinghurst Rd. The event runs from 11am until 8pm.

Road closures from 7am to 9:30pm:

  • Darlinghurst Rd between Roslyn St and Macleay St
  • Macleay St between Darlinghurst Rd and Greenknowe Ave.
  • Sections of Orwell St and Hughes St will be closed.
  • Motorists will be detoured via Greenknowe Ave and Macleay St and via Darlinghurst Rd and Roslyn St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am until 9:30pm on sections of Darlinghurst Rd, Macleay St, Orwell St, Baroda St, Hughes St and other local roads.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operators

arrangementElements.title: Road closures and special event clearways

properties.publicTransport: Extra trains will run for event participants. Visit transportnsw.info for more details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 10,000 cyclists will ride from Sydney to Fairy Meadow for the annual MS Gong Ride. The 80 km ride from Tempe Recreation Reserve starts from 6am and the 53km ride will start at Preston Park, Engadine from 8am. Both events finish at Thomas Dalton Park, Fairy Meadow by 3:45pm.

Road and lane closures will be in place along sections of the course.

  • 4am to 9:30am from Tempe to Sutherland: sections of West Botany St, Holbeach Ave and Bestic St. The speed limit will be reduced to 60/km along Rocky Point Rd/Taren Point Rd from Sans Souci to Taren Point.
  • 5am to 10am from Sutherland to Waterfall: Lane closures on the Princes Hwy from Kirrawee to Loftus and the speed limit will be reduced to 60km/h from Kirrawee to Waterfall. Delays are expected travelling southbound on the Princes Hwy during this time. 
  • 5am to 2:30pm in the Royal National Park: McKell Ave, Lady Wakehurst Dr, Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Otford Rd. Access to the Royal National Park is via Farnell Ave only. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h along Lawrence Hargrave Dr from Stanwell Park to Thirroul from 6am to 3pm.
  • 5am to 4.30pm Bulli and Fairy Meadow: sections of Elliotts Rd near the finish area will be closed and the speed limit reduced to 40km/h on sections of Elliotts Rd.

Motorists should exercise caution as cyclists will be sharing some roads along the course. Motorists are reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

Special event clearways will be in place along key sections of the course between 4am and 3pm.

  • Tempe to Kirrawee (from 4am to 10am)
  • Princes Hwy (from 4am to 11am)
  • Stanwell Park to Fairy Meadow (from 5am to 3pm)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.﻿

properties.otherAdvice:
High volumes of holiday traffic are expected approaching and through Blackheath, Mount Victoria and Lithgow during peak holiday travel periods.

On the conclusion of the Bathurst 1000, there will be a significant increase of traffic on Monday 13 October between 8am and 1pm.

When queueing begins eastbound at Mount Victoria, a traffic management plan is put in place to prevent breakdowns on Victoria Pass. Stop/slow traffic conditions will be put in place for eastbound traffic, with traffic controllers on site to direct motorists.

For details about known holiday traffic pinch points, see the NSW Holiday and Journey planning website and the pinch point journey planning tool.
